intro: Tridax platyphylla, commonly known as the common tridax or sand mat, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions. Tridax platyphylla is also considered a weed in many regions due to its invasive potential.
